**Surge Pricing**
A dynamic pricing system used by Uber to increase fares when demand from riders exceeds the number of available drivers in an area. Itâ€™s designed to encourage more drivers to come online during peak times by offering higher earnings.

**Algorithmic Pricing**
The automated process by which Uberâ€™s system adjusts fares based on real-time data like supply, demand, traffic, and location. Prices are determined not by a person but by algorithms using live inputs.

**Platform Manipulation**
When usersâ€”drivers in this caseâ€”intentionally alter their behavior to exploit the rules or algorithms of a digital platform to their advantage. In the video, this involves drivers coordinating to log off in order to trigger artificial price surges.

**Driver Incentives**
The rewards or earning opportunities Uber offers to encourage certain behaviorsâ€”like staying online during busy times, completing a certain number of rides, or accepting trips in high-demand areas. These incentives shape driver decisions and are central to how the platform functions.
